question: The course is about designing rational agents.
Weak AI defines a machine that can act intelligently.
The Turing test is a good robot performance measure.
Strong AI is the same as machine consciousness.
When you throw a dice twice, the probability of getting 6 at least once is 1/6.
Partial observability is not a problem in most cases.
A Boolean random variable is the best way to model temperature.
Conditional probability is the same as prior probability.
Structuring causal knowledge into belief networks is intuitive and helpful for humans.
Independence between variables is common in most applications.
A rational agent does not have to always choose the action that maximizes expected utility.
Humans are always irrational.
Stochastic dominance can often be determined with qualitative reasoning.
You add action nodes, utility nodes and policy nodes to a belief network in order to do rational decision making.
Case-based reasoning is a form of supervised learning.
Neural networks are typically trained with the backpropagation algorithm.
Neural networks accurately represent all the properties of real neurons.
A perceptron can be used to represent any function.
Backpropagation is the same as gradient descent.
The real world is a Partially Observable Markov Decision Process.
